phrase.item: Once there were three brothers: Qaqa, Zangibor, and Zamji the Fire-Worshipper [Otashparast].
They are called unbelievers.
Once upon a time they were here, in Wakhan. Qaqa was in [the village of] Namadgut.
[And the giants'] sister Zulkhumor was on the other side, in Afghanistan,
and Zabgibor and Zulasham were at Yamchun fortress.
Zamji the Fire-Worshipper was at the fortress of Zong [village].

They were very unkind to people, for example, and they gave people a hard time. Hazrat Ali, along with [his sons] Imam Hassan and Imam Hussein, came to Namadgut, which is just opposite the other side [Afghanistan].
[Hazrat Ali] came from the [Afghanistan] side and he saw a big stone, and next to it was the "snake water" [poisonous watering hole].
Any animals or people that drink water from there, they die.
The unbelievers ordered the people [in Namadgut] to bring their possessions, for example, their flocks of sheep, their horses, yaks if they had them -- all their possessions had to be brought over
to this side, to Qaqa.
Then Imam Husain, Imam Hasain and Hazrat Ali came and set up their tent there.
They set up their tent there, and when they woke up in the morning, they saw that they and their horses were still alive [despite "the snake water"]
So then Qaqa said,"Hey, servant, go check what kind of human these are!"
So then the servants went over there.
When one arrived and got closer, [he recognized Hazrat Ali] and said, "I offer myself up, in your name!"
I didn't know it was you, but now I recognize you."
And Hazrat Ali said "It is fine."
[And the servant replied]: "Qaqa sent me here to see what kind person you are, that you did not die there."

And [Hazrat Ali] said, "We are of a lineage that plays games and faces challenges. For one, there is the stoning game. Or the one where you put on and take off a horseshoe on a horse that is galloping fast.
And a third game is wrestling -- we wrestle."
On these three three contests will we stake ourselves, if you accept. Or if you don't accept, then don't."
Then [Hazrat Ali] put the servant on his horse Duldul [mule in Islamic tradition], and he brought him back to [his master Qaqa's] side.
But Qaqa didn't give [Hazrat Ali] back his horse.
He tied up the horse and put cotton in its ear.
Then it was whispered, "This [horse] will stay here -- you guys go with them and come back."
Then they went to some other place, and Hazrat Ali saw that there is no horse -- well, he was aware of it.
You know that bird, the swallow?
[Hazrat Ali] commanded that bird to go through any hole into the stable. And the swallow removed the cotton from the ear of Hazrat Ali's Dɨldɨl, who opened the stable door and left.
He escaped and came toward Hazrat Ali, and bends on his knees in front of him.
He bent his head.
So then Qaqa said, "He is some strange kind of a man."
He is not a mere human, he must be something else."
Then they started hitting each other with stones, and some people got hit in the head, you see, and started fighing.
Qaqa said, "This is hardly even a game, just throw it over there.
Let's say that I lost."
The second game is where a horseman removes and puts back on a horseshoe while the horse is galloping fast.
Some people fell from their horses, some dropped their hammers and pliers. When they fell, the horses trampled them and eventually they would die from the horses' kicking.
And so Qaqa said, "This is also a bad game."
Then he said, "The final game is wrestling".
He said, "Alright, yours, then, who is your fighter?"
"My fighter is Imam Hasain," said Hazrat Ali.
"Okay," said Qaqa, "I have a person who is bound up in chains.
He will swallow him," he says. "That's okay!"
When they brought him, he really was bound in chains, from both sides they were holding [his chains] and he was crashing around in [those chains].
His arms and his feet were like thick wood.
Then the attack came from unbeliever's side, and the unbeliever rotates him two times, and that's where he went.
He didn't fall down.
The third time he attacked, Imam Hassain caught him. He knocked him to the ground and pushed him into the ground up to his navel.
"You are my enemy," [said Qaqa].
"I will fight with you.
Bring your army."
[Hazrat Ali] said, "I don't have any army, I only have these two guys with me."
Then he sat on his horse Dɨldɨl, took out his sharp sword, and killed everyone.
He killed them all and made for the other side, to Afghanistan.
His sister also had someone... Zulkhumor...
Zulkhumor was a beautiful woman, and [Hazrat Ali] said, "Don't kill Zulkhumor."
Then he said to his messenger, "You go and tell her: if she agrees, I will marry her".
'zawdʒa' means wife.
"No problem," said [the messenger].
(If there is an unbeliever among Muslims, for example, the unbelievers have compassion, but when Muslims get angry, they won't have such compassion.)
When he had done that, Hazrat Bibi Fotima was sent to the Jimchun fortress,
to Zangibor.
She arrived there, she appeared there.
Well, Zangibor also had guards, but she made her way to the main square without them knowing.
"What kind of person are you?" asked the guard.
"Well," said [the messenger sent with Bibi Fotima], "I was sent to bring orders.
I brought a command, so I need the person in charge here. I am not going to tell you."
This is what he told the guard.
Then they called on the one in charge, and he said, "What kind of person are you?"
"It's like this," replied the messanger. "I come bearing a command that you should stop shooting."
"Kill fewer people, don't make your slaves suffer.
If you make do these things less, it will be good. If you don't then, we will need to do battle.
[Zangibor] said, "I am ready to do battle.
I am in charge of this place, along with my brother.
All these places are mine.
The fish in the river and the raindeer in the mountains -- all are mine".
Then he shot his bow -- back in that time, they also had those, now we would say "gun".
The arrow was shot, but [the other man] caught it and threw it back to the other side.
Again the one man shot and the other threw it back, and the third time the arrow was shot and turned around and returned back by itself.
So it came back.
The arrow turned back by itself -- and there was a waterfall there.
From there, the man jumped to the other side and disappeared.
The next day Hazrat Ali came and proceeding from above
he started putting the unbelievers to the sword, and he was injured.
Then he was approaching Yimchun, and there was a pear [tree].
A pear tree was ordained to be there, which had existed since the third century.
[The tree] brought its branch close to him, and so his wound then appeared on the forehead [of the unbeliever].

It got onto his forehead, and then Hazrat Ali hit him with the sword and said, "Throw yourself down into the dry place", but the unbeliever [being contrarian] would not consent, so he threw himself into the river.
The unbeliever threw himself in the river and Hazrat Ali came to where the hot spring is now, the hot sping of Bibi Fotima. Then he hit the mountain rock with his sword and water came out.
Hazrat Bibi Fotima held out her sleeves, and hot water came out.
Then she washed away the unbeliever's blood from their clothes.
So that Bibi Fotima hot spring has remained from the third century until now.
It is a magical place for us.
And there the unbelievers met their end. Then [Hazrat Ali] went to the fortress in Zong, and to the fortress in Virshim,
and to the [unbeliever's] young brother, Zamji the Fire-Worshipper.
[Hazrat Ali] went there and he said, "I raise my hand to say that I have not been unkind to people.
Never have I never killed anyone, never have I shot anyone.
They made me sit here, my brothers pampered me, ann they tied my fortress up with cord.
I am living here on my own."
"So you are free!" said Hazrat Ali,
and he made him go away from that place.
He sent him to Israel, he migrates through the region of the grassland houses.
He went through that region of the grassland houses.
He went to Pakistan, and from there
he went to Afghanistan, and from Pakistan to Israel.
This was their story.
The hot spring of Bibi Fotima.
The hot spring of Hazrat Bibi Fotima is now visited mostly by women who are having problems having children, for example, or who have caught a fertility "cold",
or are always sick.

For example, if they have "women's sickness", it benefits them -- they can keep warm themselves, not catch "cold" and not drink cold water. For instance, she can make herself flour soup and get herself to sweat, so it will benefit her.
For example, if the uterus has caught a "cold", the hot spring will treat them.
They enter [Bibi Fotima's "belly" [in the spring] and take a stone from there, some people find beads there, someone might drop one and another will take it.
Now "the belly" is getting very tight, it has gotten very small.
Before it was very big.
Now when the white and brown dirt comes, that fills it in.
When the dirt comes into the water and gathers together in one place, it becomes like that,
because [the springwater] is going all the time.
When all the unbelievers died here in Jimchun, the [hot spring] appeared afterwards.
After that, Hazrat Bibi Fotima washed the clothes of Hazrat Ali, Imam Hassan and Imam Hussain, washing away the blood of the unbelievers.
It is left for us as history.
This is how it happened, as we were told, and I also have told you the same.
